poem:
"Red Wheelbarrow Glances at Property Shows"

No bells to dream of.
A red wheelbarrow glitters
under our bold TV's gaze.
Unowned, yet heavy with soil and sorrow, 
it dances under the eyes of wealth,
painted with jeers of 
life's uneven distribution.
How sour the fruit of envy,
How far, the gardens of Channel 4,
from the work-worn hands,
grasping reality's handlebar.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Outrageous Homes: Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen has more fun than anyone else alive I am starting to feel sorry for Channel 4, because they are never going to make a property show I like, no matter how many times they try. This is simply because of the economic reality I live in – I don’t own property and I’m starting to think I never will, thanks woke – and that makes it grating and tedious to watch". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Outrageous Homes: Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen has more fun than anyone else alive I am starting to feel sorry for Channel 4, because they are never going to make a property show I like, no matter how many times they try. This is simply because of the economic reality I live in – I don’t own property and I’m starting to think I never will, thanks woke – and that makes it grating and tedious to watch
